meanings.definition: To surround or blockade with a line or barrier
meanings.sent1: The police cordoned off the crime scene to keep people out.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters cordoned the area to prevent the fire from spreading.
meanings.sent3: The students cordoned off their desks with tape for a fun class project.
meanings.sent4: The garden was cordoned by colorful flowers, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The security guards cordoned the VIP section, ensuring only authorized personnel could enter.

meanings.definition: A line or barrier that surrounds or blocks off an area
meanings.sent1: The yellow tape served as a cordoned around the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The police set up a cordoned to control the crowd during the event.
meanings.sent3: The cordoned of caution tape made the area look like a crime scene from a movie.
meanings.sent4: The cordoned of trees around the park provided a natural boundary.
meanings.sent5: The cordoned of colorful flags marked the route of the parade.
